properties.areaDesc: Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Wayne; Carter; Ripley; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued August 9 at 11:53PM CDT until August 10 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
The Flash Flood Watch will expire for portions of western Kentucky
and southeast Missouri, including the following areas, in western
Kentucky, Carlisle, Fulton, and Hickman. In southeast Missouri,
Butler, Carter, Mississippi, New Madrid, Ripley, Scott, Stoddard,
and Wayne MO.

The flash flooding threat for the Watch area has ended. Therefore,
the Flash Flood Watch will expire at Midnight CDT tonight.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH WILL EXPIRE AT MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT

properties.areaDesc: Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Wayne; Carter; Ripley; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued August 9 at 8:30PM CDT until August 10 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be
possible.

* WHERE...Portions of western Kentucky and southeast Missouri,
including the following areas, in western Kentucky, Carlisle,
Fulton and Hickman. In southeast Missouri, Butler, Carter,
Mississippi, New Madrid, Ripley, Scott, Stoddard and Wayne MO.

* WHEN...Until Midnight CDT tonight.

* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers,
creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur
in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be
flooded.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- One more round of heavy rain remains possible in the watch
area through this evening.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT

properties.areaDesc: Union; Johnson; Alexander; Pulaski; Massac; Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Ballard; McCracken; Graves; Marshall; Calloway; Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Wayne; Carter; Ripley; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued August 9 at 10:52AM CDT until August 10 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible.

* WHERE...Portions of southern Illinois, western Kentucky and
southeast Missouri, including the following areas, in southern
Illinois, Alexander, Johnson, Massac, Pulaski and Union. In
western Kentucky, Ballard, Calloway, Carlisle, Fulton, Graves,
Hickman, Marshall and McCracken. In southeast Missouri, Bollinger,
Butler, Cape Girardeau, Carter, Mississippi, New Madrid, Ripley,
Scott, Stoddard and Wayne MO.

* WHEN...Through this evening.

* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers,
creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur
in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be
flooded.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- Widespread rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches can be expected
through late tonight, with locally higher amounts possible.
Given the very saturated soils from recent rains, it will not
take much heavy rain to cause flooding to develop.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING

properties.areaDesc: Carlisle, KY; Fulton, KY; Hickman, KY; Bollinger, MO; Cape Girardeau, MO; Mississippi, MO; New Madrid, MO; Scott, MO; Stoddard, MO; Wayne, MO
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued August 4 at 12:29PM CDT until August 4 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.

* WHERE...Portions of western Kentucky and southeast Missouri,
including the following counties, in western Kentucky, Carlisle,
Fulton and Hickman. In southeast Missouri, Bollinger, Cape
Girardeau, Mississippi, New Madrid, Scott, Stoddard and Wayne.

* WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT.

* IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water
crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 1228 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the
warned area. Flooding is already occurring.
- Some locations include...
Sikeston, Dexter, Charleston, Portageville, East Prairie, New
Madrid, Chaffee, Fulton, Hickman, Bernie, Bloomfield, Marble
Hill, Clinton, Advance, Oran, Lilbourn, Miner, Benton,
Hunter-Dawson State Historic Site and Big Oak Tree State
Park.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

properties.areaDesc: Alexander; Pulaski; Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Ballard; Graves; Calloway; Perry; Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Wayne; Carter; Ripley; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued August 4 at 11:42AM CDT until August 4 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
The Flood Watch for portions of southern Illinois, western Kentucky,
and southeast Missouri will expire at noon, as the primary near term
threat for excessive rainfall has diminished.

Due to the exceptional rainfall realized the last 24 to 48 hours,
you should be aware of any remaining flash flood, flood, and river
flood warnings in effect. Follow flood safety rules, heed road
closure signs, and never drive across a flooded roadway.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH WILL EXPIRE AT NOON CDT TODAY
